description: Arrange the enterprise Lakehouse platform design steps in the correct order.
instructions: Think about enterprise platform architecture layers: What's the foundation everything depends on? How do you organize teams and data? Pattern: foundation → organization → data structure → cost control → security → resilience.

blocks.code: Create regional metastore(s) in Unity Catalog
blocks.label: Establish Metastore

blocks.code: Create hub + domain workspaces (platform, finance, supply_chain, marketing)
blocks.label: Design Workspace Topology

blocks.code: Create catalogs per domain: finance, supply_chain, marketing (each with raw/curated/analytics schemas)
blocks.label: Define Catalog Hierarchy

blocks.code: Create cluster policies: max 20 workers, auto-terminate 30min, approved instance types only
blocks.label: Set Cluster Policies

blocks.code: Configure GRANT/REVOKE, row-level security, audit logging to SIEM
blocks.label: Implement Governance

blocks.code: Configure DEEP CLONE for critical tables, cross-region replication, backup schedules
blocks.label: Design DR Strategy

hints: Metastore is the root — everything else depends on it
Workspace topology defines the organizational structure
Catalogs organize data by business domain within the metastore
Cluster policies control compute costs from day one
Governance secures data access and enables compliance
DR strategy protects against data loss and outages
learnings: Policies enforce cost and security guardrails
